subject: Sleep
title: Why Stage Order Matters
description: A quick, practical guide to Why Stage Order Matters.

hook.text: You can't just pick your favorite sleep stage and get eight hours of it. The order is non-negotiable.

buildup.text: The brain always enters sleep through N1, then progresses to N2, N3, back to N2, then into REM.

discovery.text: This sequence exists because each stage prepares the brain chemically for the next one.

twist.text: Alcohol disrupts this order. It pushes you into deep sleep early but steals REM sleep later.

climax.text: Forced stage disruption, as in some disorders, produces the paradox of sleeping enough but feeling awful.

punchline.text: Sleep quality depends on order, not just duration.

quiz.question: How does alcohol disrupt sleep architecture?
options: It increases deep sleep early but steals REM later
